sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含有"咬，啃"之意。
means: bite ： 指用牙齿钳住或切断，或咬一口。
gnaw ： 指连续不断用齿咬。

word_mean: 咬力：牙闭合时所用力的程度
印膜：通过咬模型物块所获取的上、下牙咬合关系的记录
咬面：人工牙的舌侧面处于切缘与肩台间的部分
咬伤：牙齿或嘴的其他部分造成的创伤

sentence.Network_cn: 我把它打跑了，但小臂被咬了一口。

sentence.Network_en: Any dog bite, no matter how small, needs immediate medical attention.
sentence.Network_cn: 被狗咬后，不管伤口多小，都必须立即就医。

phrase.cizu_name: someone's bark is worse than their bite

jx.jx_en_mean: said of someone whose fierce and intimidating manner does not reflect their nature
develop a passionate interest in a specified activity

lj.lj_ly: Joe was badly bitten by the showbiz bug at the age of four.
lj.lj_ls: 乔四岁就迷上了演艺活动。

jx.jx_en_mean: decide to do something difficult or unpleasant that one has been putting off or hesitating over
jx.jx_cn_mean: 最终下定决心行动起来

phrase.cizu_name: bite the hand that feeds one

jx.jx_en_mean: deliberately hurt or offend a benefactor
dig one's front teeth into one's lip in embarrassment, grief, or annoyance, or to prevent oneself from saying something
jx.jx_cn_mean: （因尴尬、悲伤、生气或不愿开口）而紧咬着嘴唇

jx.jx_en_mean: chew at one's nails as a nervous habit
jx.jx_cn_mean: （紧张时习惯性地）咬指甲，焦躁不安

jx.jx_en_mean: used to indicate that someone is being treated in the same way as they have treated others, typically badly
make a desperate effort to avoid saying something

lj.lj_ly: I had to bite my tongue and accept his explanation.
lj.lj_ls: 我只得一言不发地接受了他的解释。

phrase.cizu_name: one could have bitten one's tongue off

jx.jx_en_mean: used to convey that one profoundly and immediately regrets having said something

jx.jx_cn_mean: (谚)一次吃亏，下次小心；一次被咬，下次胆小

jx.jx_en_mean: (N. Amer. & Austral. informal)borrow or extort money from
jx.jx_cn_mean: (北美，澳，非正式)向…借（或勒索）钱财

means.word_mean: 咬;啃
其他释义

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English  bītan, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch bijten and German beissen

entry.def: If you bite something, you use your teeth to cut into it, for example in order to eat it or break it. If an animal or person bites you, they use their teeth to hurt or injure you.

example.ex: Both sisters bit their nails as children...
example.tran: 两姐妹都像小孩儿一样咬指甲。

example.ex: He bit into his sandwich...
example.tran: 他咬了一口他的三明治。

entry.def: A bite of something, especially food, is the action of biting it.

example.ex: He took another bite of apple...
example.tran: 他又咬了一口苹果。

example.ex: You cannot eat a bun in one bite.
example.tran: 你不能一口吃下一个面包。

entry.def: If you have a bite to eat, you have a small meal or a snack.

example.ex: It was time to go home for a little rest and a bite to eat.
example.tran: 该回家休息一会儿，吃一点儿东西了。

entry.def: If a snake or a small insect bites you, it makes a mark or hole in your skin, and often causes the surrounding area of your skin to become painful or itchy.

example.ex: When an infected mosquito bites a human, spores are injected into the blood...
example.tran: 感染病毒的蚊子叮咬人之后，孢子便被注入血液中。

example.ex: We were all badly bitten by mosquitoes.
example.tran: 我们都被蚊子咬惨了。

entry.def: A bite is an injury or a mark on your body where an animal, snake, or small insect has bitten you.

example.ex: Any dog bite, no matter how small, needs immediate medical attention.
example.tran: 被狗咬后，不管伤口多小，都必须立即就医。

entry.def: When an action or policy begins to bite, it begins to have a serious or harmful effect.

example.ex: As the sanctions begin to bite there will be more political difficulties ahead...
example.tran: 随着制裁开始产生严重的负面影响，政治上将面临更多的困难。

example.ex: The recession started biting deeply into British industry.
example.tran: 经济萧条开始对英国的工业产生严重影响。

entry.def: If an object bites into a surface, it presses hard against it or cuts into it.

example.ex: There may even be some wire or nylon biting into the flesh...
example.tran: 甚至可能有一些金属丝或者尼龙线勒到肉里。

example.ex: The car's tires bit loudly on the rutted snow in the street.
example.tran: 汽车轮子碾入街道上布满车辙的雪里，发出很大的声响。

entry.tran: （食物或酒的）浓郁味道，辛辣味
entry.def: If you say that a food or drink has bite, you like it because it has a strong or sharp taste.

example.ex: ...the addition of tartaric acid to give the wine some bite.
example.tran: 为增加红酒的口感而加入酒石酸

entry.def: If the air or the wind has a bite, it feels very cold.

example.ex: There was a bite in the air, a smell perhaps of snow.
example.tran: 空气非常寒冷，似乎有雪的味道。

entry.def: If something such as a performance or a piece of writing has bite, it is exciting or effective.

example.ex: The teams have that extra bite when they are playing against their neighbours...
example.tran: 这几支队伍与其邻近地区队伍交手时锐气更盛。

example.ex: The novel seems to lack bite and tension—even passion.
example.tran: 这部小说乏善可陈，没有紧张的情节——甚至缺少激情。

entry.def: If a fish bites when you are fishing, it takes the hook or bait at the end of your fishing line in its mouth.

example.ex: After half an hour, the fish stopped biting and we moved on.
example.tran: 半个小时以后，鱼儿不再咬钩了，我们只好换地方。

entry.def: A bite of something is a small part or amount of it.

example.ex: ...bites of conversation.
example.tran: 谈话的片段

entry.tran: 恩将仇报；以怨报德；忘恩负义
entry.def: If someone bites the hand that feeds them, they behave badly or in an ungrateful way towards someone who they depend on.

example.ex: She may be cynical about the film industry, but ultimately she has no intention of biting the hand that feeds her.
example.tran: 她对电影业可能有些怀疑失望，但终究没有恩将仇报之意。

entry.def: If someone speaks or replies to you angrily, and you think they are being unfair or reacting too strongly, you can say that they bite your head off .

example.ex: Whenever possible, suggest she talks about it but be aware she may bite your head off for your trouble.
example.tran: 找机会建议她谈谈这事儿，但是小心她可能会因为你多事儿而大发雷霆。

entry.def: If you bite your lip or your tongue, you stop yourself from saying something that you want to say, because it would be the wrong thing to say in the circumstances.

example.ex: I must learn to bite my lip...
example.tran: 我必须学会不乱说话。

example.ex: He bit his tongue as he found himself on the point of saying 'follow that car'.
example.tran: 他想说“跟上那辆车”，话到嘴边又咽了回去。

entry.tran: 抽出一部分，拿出一部分（钱）
entry.def: If something takes a bite out of a sum of money, part of the money is spent or taken away in order to pay for it.

example.ex: Local taxes are going to be taking a bigger bite out of people's income than they ever have before.
example.tran: 地方税收在人们收入中的比重将超过以往任何时候。

means.word_mean: 1. a wound resulting from biting by an animal or a person
2. a small amount of solid food; a mouthful;

sentences.sentence: "all they had left was a bit of bread"

means.word_mean: 3. a painful wound caused by the thrust of an insect's stinger into skin
4. a light informal meal
5. (angling) an instance of a fish taking the bait;

sentences.sentence: "after fishing for an hour he still had not had a bite"

means.word_mean: 6. wit having a sharp and caustic quality;
7. a strong odor or taste property;
8. the act of gripping or chewing off with the teeth and jaws
9. a portion removed from the whole;

sentences.sentence: "the government's weekly bite from my paycheck"

means.word_mean: 1. to grip, cut off, or tear with or as if with the teeth or jaws;
2. cause a sharp or stinging pain or discomfort;
3. penetrate or cut, as with a knife;
4. deliver a sting to;

auth_sentence.res_content_con: The tiger mosquito's bite is more than annoying.

auth_sentence.content: The jaws that bite, the claws that catch!
auth_sentence.res_content: The jaws that bite, the claws that catch!
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The jaws that bite, the claws that catch!

Sentence.sentence: What controls remain for the users will be audio-based, so, for example, you'll just have to say "a bit warmer", and the air conditioning will adjust automatically.
Could you tell me a bit about the business your company is doing?
I'm thinking about where to go for a bite tonight.
Corporate bonds are a bit more risky.
That depends a little bit on the price.
Taking a step that many professors may view as a bit counterproductive, some colleges and universities are doling out Apple iPhones and Internet-capable iPods to their students.

means.word_mean: 咬, 叮, 蛰

sentences.en: She bit the thread in two.

means.word_mean: 咬

sentences.en: He ate the whole cake in three bites.
sentences.cn: 他三口就吃下整块蛋糕。

means.word_mean: 咬伤, 叮伤, 蛰伤

sentences.en: He soon recovered from the snake's bite.
sentences.cn: 他被蛇咬的伤很快就痊愈了。

means.word_mean: 有咬(或叮)的习性，(狗等)爱咬人
(螺丝、锚等的)咬住物体，咬紧；攫住；钉牢

sentences.en: The car wheels bit into the snow.
sentences.cn: 汽车车轮在雪地上紧紧咬住不打滑。

means.word_mean: (人)上当，受骗，中计，信以为真

sentences.en: She knew that was a mistake,but she bit anyway.
sentences.cn: 她明知那里是错误的，但是还是上当受骗了。

means.word_mean: 起有利(或不利)的作用，产生良好(或不良)影响

sentences.en: The company's measures are beginning to bite.
sentences.cn: 公司的措施已初见成效。

means.word_mean: 咬出，咬成

sentences.en: The dog bit me on the leg.

means.word_mean: (利器等)刺进，刺穿

sentences.en: The Sword split the Knight's helmet and bit him fatally.
sentences.cn: 剑劈开了骑士的头盔并致命地刺进他。

means.word_mean: (寒风等)刺骨，使感到刺痛，刺痛，刺伤；(严寒)冻伤，冻疼，冻坏

sentences.en: an icy wind that bit my face

means.word_mean: (辣椒，胡椒等)刺激，辣(鼻)
(酸等)腐蚀；侵蚀
欺骗，哄骗，诈骗，使上当，利用[仅用于被动语态]

sentences.en: to get bitten in a mail-order swindle
sentences.cn: 在一个邮购骗局中受骗

jushi.english: The rails were covered with ice and the wheels did not bite.
jushi.chinese: 铁轨上盖着冰,车轮卡不住轨。

jushi.english: The fish are biting well today.
